Location: Old Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Timings: 09:30 AM – 4:30 PM (Closed on Mondays / special events)
Entry Fee: Indian Visitors ~₹35, Foreign Visitors ~₹550 (subject to ASI updates)
Accessibility: Partial wheelchair access; road access good but narrow lanes nearby
Guided Tours: Local guides available in English/Hindi; ASI audio/guide options sometimes available
Parking: Limited nearby parking; paid parking around Chandni Chowk / Sunehri Masjid
Nearby Amenities: Chandni Chowk eateries, street food, small shops, public toilets
Special Notes: Iconic Mughal fort; Independence Day flag hoisting & official ceremonies held annually; heavy crowds during festivals and national events

Location: Mehrauli (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Type: Historical Monument / UNESCO World Heritage Site
Timings: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM (Sunrise to sunset; closed on certain national holidays)
Entry Fee: Indian Visitors ~₹35, Foreign Visitors ~₹550–₹600 (subject to ASI updates)
Accessibility: Partial wheelchair access; some uneven pathways
Guided Tours: Local guides available in English/Hindi; audio guide options sometimes available
Nearby Amenities: Cafes and restaurants nearby; restrooms; small shops
Special Notes: Part of Qutub complex with Iron Pillar; UNESCO World Heritage site; security checks enforced

Location: Central Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Type: War Memorial / Open Monument / Park area
Nearest Metro Station: Central Secretariat / Patel Chowk / Udyog Bhawan
Accessibility: Wheelchair friendly; wide paved pathways
Guided Tours: City guides and HOHO buses include India Gate
Parking: Nearby paid parking (Connaught Place / Raisina Hill)
Nearby Amenities: Restaurants, cafes, souvenir stalls, restrooms
Special Notes: War memorial for WWI soldiers; heavy crowds on national holidays; popular for evening walks and photography

Location: Nizamuddin / Mathura Road (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Type: Historical Monument / UNESCO World Heritage Site
Entry Fee: Indian Visitors ~₹35, Foreign Visitors ~₹550–₹600; photography fees may apply
Accessibility: Garden pathways partially wheelchair-friendly; some uneven heritage paths
Guided Tours: Local guides available; ASI signage and audio guides available
Parking: Nearby parking at Nizamuddin / Mathura Road
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, Nizamuddin Dargah precincts, restrooms, small shops
Special Notes: Mughal architecture precursor to Taj Mahal; UNESCO World Heritage Site; large gardens and tomb complexes

Location: Kalkaji / Bahapur (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Timings: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM (Tuesday–Sunday; check official site for seasonal updates)
Accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; garden pathways and meditation hall accessible
Guided Tours: Volunteer staff explain visitor etiquette; formal guided tours generally not conducted inside the hall
Nearby Amenities: Gardens, small cafes nearby, restrooms
Special Notes: Famous lotus-shaped architecture; open to people of all religions; photography and silence etiquette enforced

Location: Old Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Timings: 7:00 AM – 12:00 PM & 1:30 PM – 6:30 PM (visiting outside prayer hours)
Accessibility: Stone steps; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available (English/Hindi)
Parking: Very limited; use nearby paid parking at Chandni Chowk
Nearby Amenities: Famous street food (parathas, kebabs), markets (Chandni Chowk), shops, restrooms
Special Notes: One of India’s largest mosques; access restricted during prayer times and festivals

Location: Old Delhi Market & Heritage Area (National Capital Territory of Delhi)

Nearby Amenities: Eateries, sweet shops, jewelry and textile shops, restrooms
Special Notes: Historic market near Red Fort & Jama Masjid; famous for street food and traditional shops

Entry Fee: Free; guided tours for residence require prior booking

Guided Tours: Prior booking needed for inside Rashtrapati Bhavan; guided garden tours available

Nearby Amenities: Cafes/restrooms at designated spots; shops Not documented
Special Notes: Presidential residence; Mughal Gardens seasonal access; Indo-Saracenic architecture

Location: Saidul Ajaib / Mehrauli (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; well-maintained paved paths
Guided Tours: Available on request; photography and nature walks encouraged
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, restrooms, small shops
Special Notes: Includes themed gardens, cultural exhibits, sculptures, and fountains; ideal for nature photography and leisure

Location: New Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; well-maintained pathways; popular for morning walks and jogs
Guided Tours: Not documented
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, restaurants, restrooms, Khan Market shopping area
Special Notes: Spread over 90 acres, the garden houses tombs from the Sayyid and Lodi dynasties, including Sikandar Lodi's tomb and the Bara Gumbad mosque.

Location: Chanakyapuri (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Nearest Metro Station: Lok Kalyan Marg Metro Station (Yellow Line)
Accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; interactive exhibits suitable for all ages
Guided Tours: Available; audio guides and guided tours in multiple languages
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, souvenir shops, restrooms
Special Notes: The museum showcases India's railway heritage, featuring vintage locomotives, royal coaches, and interactive displays.

Location: Pragati Maidan (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Timings: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM (closed on Holi and Diwali)
Accessibility: Fully wheelchair-accessible; interactive and engaging exhibits for children and adults
Guided Tours: Available; educational programs and workshops conducted regularly
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, restaurants, restrooms
Special Notes: The centre features a wide range of exhibits on science and technology, including a 3D theatre and interactive displays.

Location: Hauz Khas (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Timings: Shops and cafes typically open from 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Accessibility: Partially wheelchair-accessible; cobblestone streets may be challenging
Guided Tours: Not documented
Nearby Amenities: Boutiques, art galleries, cafes, restaurants, restrooms
Special Notes: A blend of medieval history and modern culture, featuring a historic water tank, Islamic monuments, and a vibrant urban village atmosphere.

Location: New Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; well-maintained pathways
Guided Tours: Not documented
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, restaurants, restrooms
Special Notes: A late Mughal architecture marvel, often referred to as a 'mini Taj Mahal,' built in 1754 for Nawab Safdarjung.

Location: Kashmere Gate (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Nearest Metro Station: Kashmere Gate Metro Station (Red, Yellow & Violet Lines)
Timings: Sunday services: Winter 9:00 AM; Summer 8:30 AM; open for visitors on weekdays 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Accessibility: Wheelchair-accessible; well-maintained interiors; colonial-era architecture with pews and high ceilings
Guided Tours: Not documented; local guides sometimes available for historical insights
Nearby Amenities: Cafes and eateries in the surrounding Kashmere Gate area; restrooms nearby; souvenir shops limited
Special Notes: One of the oldest churches in Delhi, built in 1826; known as the 'Skinner’s Church' (after Colonel James Skinner); British-era colonial architecture; peaceful site amidst busy city traffic; ideal for photography and historical interest.

Location: Connaught Place (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Nearest Metro Station: Rajiv Chowk Metro Station (Yellow & Blue Lines)
Accessibility: Partially wheelchair-friendly; some structures have steep steps
Guided Tours: Local guides available in English/Hindi
Nearby Amenities: Restaurants, cafes, shops, restrooms
Special Notes: Built in 1724 by Maharaja Jai Singh II; collection of architectural astronomical instruments.

Location: Mathura Road / Pragati Maidan (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Accessibility: Garden pathways mostly accessible; some uneven stone areas
Guided Tours: Local guides available; heritage walks sometimes organized
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, souvenir shops, restrooms
Special Notes: One of Delhi’s oldest forts; museum inside; hosts cultural events and sound-light shows.

Location: Teen Murti Bhavan (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Nearest Metro Station: Lok Kalyan Marg Metro Station (Yellow Line)
Accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; indoor facilities accessible
Guided Tours: Staff explain exhibits; shows available in English/Hindi
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, restrooms, small gift shops
Special Notes: Educational center for astronomy and space science; planetarium shows popular for students and tourists.

Location: INA / Pitampura (National Capital Territory of Delhi)

Guided Tours: Not documented

Special Notes: Traditional crafts and cuisines from all Indian states; cultural performances frequently held.

Location: Central Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)

Accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; wide boulevards and lawns

Nearby Amenities: Cafes, restaurants, restrooms, souvenir stalls
Special Notes: Home to official parades, India Gate, and Rashtrapati Bhavan view; ideal for morning/evening walks and photography.

Location: Connaught Place (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Nearest Metro Station: Rajiv Chowk Metro Station (Yellow & Blue Lines)
Accessibility: Not fully wheelchair-accessible; stone steps and narrow spaces
Guided Tours: Local guides available; photography tours sometimes organized
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, restaurants, Connaught Place shopping area
Special Notes: 14th-century stepwell; historic water conservation structure; popular with photographers and history enthusiasts.

Location: Mehrauli / South Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
Accessibility: Steep terrain; not wheelchair-friendly; trekking difficulty moderate
Guided Tours: Local guides sometimes available; history tours possible
Nearby Amenities: Minimal amenities; bring water and snacks
Special Notes: 14th-century fort built by Ghiyas-ud-din Tughlaq; large ruins on a hill; offers panoramic views of Delhi; popular for history and photography enthusiasts.
